page.title: 12SOCIAL WORKERS-GALSTON
page.content: A social worker's role is to help people over their problems.Financial difficulties amongst elderly people are common.Up until 1968 there were many independent advice agencies.Then the Scottish Social Working Act came through and all agencies joined together and formed the Social working system of today.The greatest change in Social Working is that they now are forced to abide by a set of rules.In Galston there is a ten-man staff who find Christmas,New Year and the few weeks before summer bad financial times.They also write Social Background reports for courts, Children's Panels and Adoption work. The office is open ten hours every week day.When closed a stand-by service in Glasgow is put into action. The role of a Social Worker is very wide and varied.
